intro: Casparya trisulcata, commonly known as the three-ridged caspary, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with three distinct ridges on the underside, giving it its scientific name. Casparya trisulcata is primarily found in southern Africa, where it thrives in specific microhabitats.
